it.polimi.se2019.controller.statePattern

Class FinalScoringState

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.controller.statePattern.FinalScoringState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    State

    public class FinalScoringState
extends java.lang.Object
implements State
    Author:
    LudoLerma, FedericoMainettiGambera this state is meant to score the kill shot track and provide a final ranking. It is, obviously, only called once, at the end of the game

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  FinalScoringState.PlayerPoint
      structure needed to score the kills

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      private java.util.ArrayList<FinalScoringState.PlayerPoint> graduatory
      a list of players with their points in decreasing order
      private static java.util.logging.Logger logger 
      private static java.io.PrintWriter out

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void askForInput(Player playerToAsk)
      no input required
      private void bubbleSort()
      very common and simple function to order a list, known as bubbleSort ( although there are more efficent algorythm of sorting, linear complexity of this one for list of under 20 elements is satisfying )
      void doAction(ViewControllerEvent viewControllerEvent)
      this doAction does this things in this order: 1: score the playerBoards that got some damages on it even if the owners of said playerBoards are still alive 2: calls function getgraduatory 3:Effectuate the necessary calculus to get the very final ranking, adding up, for each player, the points earned during the whole game play, the points from overkills and the points from number of killshots it eventually effectuate a bubble sort in order to get the ranking, calls a MVE event in order to get all clients to see the ranking and ends the application
      private void getGraduatory()
      this function analyze the killshot track in order to get a final score for each player and a graduatory
      void handleAFK()
      set the player AFK in case they don't send required input in a while
      private void scoreTokens(Player player)
      when the game ends, we score any player that still got tokens on his damage track
      private void sendResults(java.util.ArrayList<FinalScoringState.PlayerPoint> classifica)
      send results to all clients
      private void setPoints(int punti)
      gives deserved points based on number of killshots

      • doAction

        public void doAction(ViewControllerEvent viewControllerEvent)
        this doAction does this things in this order: 1: score the playerBoards that got some damages on it even if the owners of said playerBoards are still alive 2: calls function getgraduatory 3:Effectuate the necessary calculus to get the very final ranking, adding up, for each player, the points earned during the whole game play, the points from overkills and the points from number of killshots it eventually effectuate a bubble sort in order to get the ranking, calls a MVE event in order to get all clients to see the ranking and ends the application
        Specified by:
        doAction in interface State
        Parameters:
        viewControllerEvent - the event with information from the user as response to the askForInput

      • setPoints

        private void setPoints(int punti)
        gives deserved points based on number of killshots
        Parameters:
        punti - needed because if nobody died, nobody deserves the points for max number of killshots

      • sendResults

        private void sendResults(java.util.ArrayList<FinalScoringState.PlayerPoint> classifica)
        send results to all clients
        Parameters:
        classifica - obviously needed to know the rankings to send

        public void handleAFK()
        set the player AFK in case they don't send required input in a while
        Specified by:
        handleAFK in interface State

      • scoreTokens

        private void scoreTokens(Player player)
        when the game ends, we score any player that still got tokens on his damage track
        Parameters:
        player - we do it for every player

      • getGraduatory

        private void getGraduatory()
        this function analyze the killshot track in order to get a final score for each player and a graduatory

      • bubbleSort

        private void bubbleSort()
        very common and simple function to order a list, known as bubbleSort ( although there are more efficent algorythm of sorting, linear complexity of this one for list of under 20 elements is satisfying )
